column4: Yesterday my Ubuntu system froze and I was forced to hard reset. Unfortunately now when my system loads up and I choose Ubuntu 9.04 (kernel 2.6.28-13-generic) I get the normal "Boot from (hd0,0) Starting up..." notification and I even see the Ubuntu logo with the slider bar moving back and forth, but instead of the normal loading I get a blank screen which eventually tells me "[     154.804.258] ata8.00 status: { DRDY  }" and "[    1
64.8122020] ata8: SRST failed". My Hard drive is a Western Digital Raptor 74gb 10000rpm drive model WD740ADFD-00NLR5 and I am running an Asus A8n32SLI-Deluxe motherboard with their 1303 bios.
download western digitals disk diagnostics and see if you can verify the disk/controller/mobo with it....
